verses.verse: (Elihu Proclaims God’s Justice) Then Elihu continued and said:
“Hear my words, you wise men, and give ear to me, you who know,
(Job 12.11) for the ear tests words as the palate tastes food.
(1 Thess 5.21) Let us choose what is right; let us determine among ourselves what is good.
For Job has said, ‘I am innocent, and God has taken away my right;
(Jer 15.18; 30.12) in spite of being right I am counted a liar; my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.’
(Job 15.16) Who is there like Job, who drinks up scoffing like water,
(Ps 50.18) who goes in company with evildoers and walks with the wicked?
(Job 21.15; 35.3) For he has said, ‘It profits one nothing to take delight in God.’
(Job 8.3) “Therefore, hear me, you who have sense; far be it from God that he should do wickedness and from the Almighty (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai) that he should do wrong.
(Ps 62.12; Mt 16.27; Rom 2.6; 2 Cor 5.10; Rev 22.12) For according to their deeds he will repay them, and according to their ways he will make it befall them.
(Job 8.3) Of a truth, God will not do wickedly, and the Almighty (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai) will not pervert justice.
(Job 38.5, 6) Who gave him charge over the earth, and who laid on him (Heb lacks on him) the whole world?
(Ps 104.29) If he should take back his spirit (Heb his heart his spirit) to himself and gather to himself his breath,
(Gen 3.19; Isa 40.6, 7) all flesh would perish together, and all mortals return to dust.
“If you have understanding, hear this; listen to what I say.
(2 Sam 23.3) Shall one who hates justice govern? Will you condemn one who is righteous and mighty,
(Ex 22.28) who says to a king, ‘You scoundrel!’ and to princes, ‘You wicked men!’;
(Deut 10.17; Job 31.15; Gal 2.6) who shows no partiality to nobles, nor regards the rich more than the poor, for they are all the work of his hands?
(Ex 12.29; Job 12.19) In a moment they die; at midnight the people are shaken and pass away, and the mighty are taken away by no human hand.
(Job 31.4) “For his eyes are upon the ways of mortals, and he sees all their steps.
(Ps 139.12; Am 9.2, 3) There is no gloom or deep darkness where evildoers may hide themselves.
For he has not appointed a time (Cn: Heb yet) for anyone to go before God in judgment.
(Dan 2.21) He shatters the mighty without investigation and sets others in their place.
(vv 11, 20) Thus, knowing their works, he overturns them in the night, and they are crushed.
(Job 26.12) He strikes them for their wickedness while others look on,
(1 Sam 15.11; Ps 28.5; Isa 5.12) because they turned aside from following him and had no regard for any of his ways,
(Ex 22.23; Job 35.9; Jas 5.4) so that they caused the cry of the poor to come to him, and he heard the cry of the afflicted—
(1 Chr 22.9) When he is quiet, who can condemn? When he hides his face, who can behold him? Whether nation or person, it is the same—
(v 17) so that the godless should not reign or those who ensnare the people.
“For has anyone said to God, ‘I have endured punishment; I will not offend any more;
(Job 35.11; Ps 25.4) teach me what I do not see; if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more’?
Will he then pay back to suit you because you reject it? For you must choose and not I; therefore declare what you know. (Meaning of Heb of 34.29-33 uncertain)
Those who have sense will say to me, and the wise who hear me will say,
(Job 35.16) ‘Job speaks without knowledge; his words are without insight.’
(Job 22.15; 23.10) Would that Job were tried to the limit, because his answers are those of the wicked.
For he adds rebellion to his sin; he claps his hands among us and multiplies his words against God.”
